summary: Hairpin match rewrite verification complete. All 8 backend API tests pass. Frontend UI testing confirms the hairpin design panel shows all required fields: Rod Dia, Rod Spacing, Hairpin Length (physical inches input), Ideal Length, Actual Length, X_L Actual, DRIVEN ELEMENT SHORTENING section with per-side shortening and new total length. Custom hairpin length input correctly affects X_L actual calculation (22.23" → 83.06Ω, 10" → 36.33Ω).
context_for_next_testing_agent: Hairpin match rewrite fully verified. The old ratio-based bar position slider has been replaced with physical length input in inches. The hairpin design panel (visible when Hairpin button is clicked) shows: Feedpoint R, Target (50Ω), Q Match, X_L (hairpin), X_C (element), Hairpin Z0, plus input fields for Rod Dia, Rod Spacing, and Hairpin Length. The DRIVEN ELEMENT SHORTENING section shows exact per-side shortening guidance. For R >= 50 (rare with standard Yagi spacing), the panel shows a topology_note suggesting Gamma match. Backend tests verify all hairpin_design fields are returned correctly.

test_results.swr_varies: Backend test confirms SWR changes with different lengths

hairpin_2element_topology.note: For R >= 50 case, backend returns topology_note suggesting Gamma match

elements_found: Hairpin Length input field (placeholder shows ideal)
